channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2024020575
item.description:
Report X-2024020575

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024020575 -RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE IRREG AREA. RESPONDER DONNED PROPER PPE AND COLLECTED PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TRAY. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO DMP FOR PROCESSING. X-2024020576 -RESPONDER CALLED TO RESPOND TO A WET PKG. RESPONDER DONNED ALL PPE AND FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP AND PROCESS THRU PROPER DMP PROCEDURES.

Report X-2024021003

  • City: PALMETTO

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found the box leaking on the floor and quickly cleaned it up. DescribePack: The cap was loose on one of the bottles causing it to leak out DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Put safely into a closed hazmat bin and placed in hazmat cage

item.title: Report X-2024021022
item.description:
Report X-2024021022

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: COCOA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS TILTED EITHER IN TRANSIT OR LOADED IMPROPER. IT WAS DISCOVERED BY UNLOADERS AS A WET PACKAGE AND PLACED IN A RED LINED BIN FOR INSPECTION. DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION THE LID WAS DISCOVERED LOOSE AND WHEN REMOVED SHOWED THE SAFETY SEAL WAS BROKEN . THERE WAS APPROX 4 FL OZ MISSING FROM THE BOTTLE THAT HAD LEAKED INTERNAL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: LID WAS TIGHTENED AND PACKAGE WAS PLACED UPRIGHT ACCORDING TO DIRECTIONAL ARROWS

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found damaged, immediately placed in a double lined hazmat bin, and placed in a well ventilated area. DescribePack: Loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: immediately placed in a double lined hazmat bin, and placed in a well ventilated area.

item.title: Report X-2024021028
item.description:
Report X-2024021028

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Oxidizer & Corrosive hazmat package was found wet. Upon inspection found 1 bottle of Rapicide PA part A 5-liters was leaking due to a defective lid. The lid had a small manufactured hole on top that was allowing liquid content to leak out. DescribePack: Bottle was leaking due to a defective lid. The lid had a small manufactured hole on top that was allowing liquid content to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020942
item.description:
Report X-2024020942

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-20T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station and it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: All 4 plastic bottles of StatLab Decal Stat leaked from loose caps. About 20 ounces were released. The bottles had a seal but the caps were not secured. No padding or inner packaging materials were used. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival of the wet package, it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

Report X-2024020351

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found wet at Orlando Local terminal and moved to the hub for reports. DescribePack: The caps on both of the jugs in the box had loose caps, causing contents to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed upright into a hazbag lined tote.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET BOX DISCOVERED DURING PRELOAD SORT. DURING INSPECTION IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT BOTTLES LEAKED. PACKAGE PLACED IN PLASTIC BAG AND PLACED AT HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: WET BOX PLACED IN PLASTIC BAG AND TAKEN TO HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024020609
item.description:
Report X-2024020609

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-24
  • City: POMPANO BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found on the 500/600 Belt leaking. It was put into a red tote and hauled off to the HazMat Cage for processing. DescribePack: The cap came loose from two plastic jugs. Seals under caps off. The box was soaked on the upper side. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: A red tote and HazMat bag were used to contain the spill. It was moved to the HazMat Cage.

item.title: Report X-2024020338
item.description:
Report X-2024020338

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-17
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station. Then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: The plastic bottle of Kester 186-18 soldering flux leaked from a loose cap. About 20 ounces were released. No padding or inner packaging materials were used. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival, the wet package was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

item.title: Report X-2024020730
item.description:
Report X-2024020730

  • City: ORLANDO
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was found wet in the load area and moved to the hazmat cage for reports. DescribePack: One of the jugs in the box leaked a small amount of contents from under the cap, even though the cap was on tight. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was placed into a hazbag lined tote.
